Stationary Light Source

Idea

A light source is subject to the same matrix transformations as a primitive. By changing the location in the program at which the light position is set we can achieve different effects.

To keep the light fixed set its position before any modeling transformations.

The example shows a teapot that can be viewed from its left or right (being determined by standing on the teapot looking towards the spout). Since the fixed light illuminates only the right side of the teapot, when we change the viewpoint to look at the left side it is dark.
